body: Investigating a "TypeError: Unsupported command argument type: TrueClass" on context "super_fetch startup" when updating from sidekiq 7.1.6 to 7.2.0. Sidekiq pro is still 7.1.6. Looks like our dependabot missed that there was a 7.2.0 upgrade.  I'm thinking we should assert that `Sidekiq::VERSION == Sidekiq::Pro::VERSION` in our test suite.

It is wrong to update only the Sidekiq gem. You must update with “bundle up sidekiq-ent” or pro so Bundler can assure the comm and oss gems are version compatible.

the assert’s a bad idea because you might have OSS 7.2.1 running with Pro 7.2.0.

Hi I'm getting `TypeError: Unsupported command argument type: TrueClass` aswell. I'm not using Sidekiq Pro.

Is there anything else I have to do?

> Is there anything else I have to do?

Show us a backtrace.


Oh, sorry, must've missed that :sweat_smile: 

To anyone with the same issue: There's a PR for it already (https://github.com/mhenrixon/sidekiq-unique-jobs/pull/815)

@mperham , our issue was caused by using `sidekiq-ent-7.1.2/lib/sidekiq-ent/senate.rb:84:in 'block in stage_coup!'` with sidekiq 7.2.0
If the gems are supposed to be locked together, can you please consider a short-circuit with an error message saying that?

@Greg-Myers-SB If you use `bundle up sidekiq`, you will break Sidekiq Pro/Ent. Always upgrade the highest-level gem. To use a house analogy, otherwise you are upgrading the foundation but not the parts above the foundation. https://github.com/sidekiq/sidekiq/wiki/Commercial-FAQ#how-do-i-upgrade-sidekiq-pro-or-sidekiq-enterprise
And yes, I think it would be reasonable for Pro/Ent to check that all Sidekiq gems are using the same MAJOR.MINOR.

Totally appreciate that it's documented well here, and known within my organisation. The combination of Dependabot upgrading anything it can get it's hands on, and some level of human error (to be clear, ours) leads to anything possible will happen eventually 😓 
Thanks for all you do on Sidekiq 🙏

issue.title: Fix broken CI against Sidekiq 7.2

repository.name: sidekiq-scheduler
repository.description: Lightweight job scheduler extension for Sidekiq

issue.body:
The API of Redis commands via Sidekiq was changed at Sidekiq 7.2. This PR fixes to use the new style.

Ref: https://github.com/sidekiq/sidekiq/issues/6083、 https://github.com/sidekiq/sidekiq/commit/3b8a3c3ea29b63b21e01010f630c936d25265712

body:
Hi all,

We are using sidekiq-ent has and ran into the same problem, thanks for the help. Has anyone been able to set up dependabot bumps for sidekiq where human interventions is not needed.
Thanks

@leorseligmann even with Dependabot it's worth looking at it with a human eye as it's possible the dependabot run could happen during a sidekiq release (very small but not zero chance) and the best you can do is ask dependabot to look for new versions at the same time, not that the versions match.

If you still wanted to, it would look like this:
```yaml
...
updates:
  - package-ecosystem: bundler
    groups:
      # Sidekiq can have issues updating these separately https://github.com/sidekiq/sidekiq/issues/6083
      all-of-sidekiq:
        patterns:
          - "sidekiq*"
...
```
